Information.Help Text: Display an image, icon, or initials. Available as a partial template to display a single row.

Help.Help Text: Select the type of content that will be displayed in the avatar.

Use the Media popup dialog to select a source for the avatar image.

Available options include:

  • URL
  • BLOB Column
  • URL Column
Enter a short description of the image or select a source column from the quick pick options. This will be used as alt text for the avatar image.
Select the source column to be displayed within each avatar. Only varchar2 data types are supported.
Enter an icon class or use the Pick Icon dialog to select the icon you want to add to display in the avatar.
Select the shape of the avatar. Default inherits the shape set by the containing template.
Displayed within a square with rounded corners.
Displayed within a circular shape.
Displayed within a square shape.
Set the size of the avatar. The default inherits the sizing set by the containing template.
Enter classes to add to this component. You may add multiple classes by separating them with a space.

Information.Help Text: Display content within a badge. Available for multiple report rows or a single row.

Help.Help Text: Enter a value for the badge label or select a source column from the quick pick options.
Select a source column for the badge value.
Select the source column for the state of the badge. Substitute column value with "danger", "warning", "success" or "info" for default styling.
Enter an icon class or use the Pick Icon dialog to select the icon you want to add to display in the badge.
Specify whether to display or hide the badge label. When set to Yes, the badge label will be displayed in addition to the badge value. When set to No, only the badge value will be displayed.
Select the badge style. Default inherits the style set by the containing template.
Select the shape of the badge. Default inherits the shape set by the containing template.
Displayed with rounded corners.
Displayed with circular edges.
Displayed with squared edges.
Set the size of the badge. The default inherits the sizing set by the containing template.

Templates.Partial:
{if APEX$IS_LAZY_LOADING/}
{if DISPLAY_AVATAR%assigned/}
{with/} SIZE:=t-Avatar--xs SHAPE:=#AVATAR_SHAPE# {apply THEME$AVATAR/}
{endif/}
{else/}
{if DISPLAY_AVATAR/}
{with/} TYPE:=#AVATAR_TYPE# IMAGE:=#AVATAR_IMAGE# IMAGE_ALT:=#AVATAR_IMAGE_ALT# ICON:=#AVATAR_ICON# INITIALS:=#AVATAR_INITIALS# SIZE:=t-Avatar--xs SHAPE:=#AVATAR_SHAPE# CSS_CLASSES:=u-color LINK:=#AVATAR_LINK# LINK_ATTR:=#AVATAR_LINK_ATTR!RAW# {apply THEME$AVATAR/}
{endif/}
{if USER_NAME_LINK/}{endif/}#USER_NAME!RAW#{if USER_NAME_LINK/}{endif/} {if COMMENT_DATE/}#COMMENT_DATE!RAW#{endif/} {if ACTIONS/}#ACTIONS!RAW#{endif/}
#COMMENT_TEXT!RAW# {if ATTRIBUTES/}
#ATTRIBUTES!RAW#
{endif/}
{endif/}

Information.Help Text: Display user comments and status updates. Supports avatars. Available for a single row or as a report with multiple rows.

Help.Help Text: Select a source column containing text for user comments.

Examples.Demo Value: Praesent vel felis rutrum erat elementum viverra sit amet non odio. Cras vel auctor eros, in malesuada dolor. Nulla tellus magna, ornare consectetur purus id, volutpat egestas felis. Proin lobortis risus massa, nec faucibus arcu malesuada a. Nunc sed gravida urna. Fusce at ligula sed erat consequat pharetra.

Help.Help Text: Select a source column to be displayed as the user name associated with a comment.
Select a source column containing a date, date range, or time.
Enter some text and/or column substitution strings to be used as the comment attributes.
Select the type of content that will be displayed in the avatar.

Use the Media popup dialog to select a source for the avatar image.

Available options include:

  • URL
  • BLOB Column
  • URL Column
Enter a short description of the image or select a source column from the quick pick options. This will be used as alt text for the avatar image.
Select the source column to be displayed within each avatar. Only varchar2 data types are supported.
Enter an icon class or use the Pick Icon dialog to select the icon you want to add to display in the avatar.
Select the shape of the avatar. Default inherits the shape set by the containing template.
Displayed within a square with rounded corners.
Displayed within a circular shape.
Displayed within a square shape.
Displayed inline without a containing shape.
Specify whether to display or hide the avatar for each row. When set to Yes, an avatar will be displayed with the assigned image, icon, or initials. When set to No, no avatar will be displayed.
Set the style of the comments.

Specify whether to use the Universal Theme colors for avatar and badge row items. When set to Yes, the u-colors class will be applied to each row. When set to No, a default color will be used instead.

Information.Help Text: Display content in a formatted row with a title, description, and more. Supports avatars and badges. Available for a single row or as a report with multiple rows.

Help.Help Text: Enter some text and/or column substitution strings to display at the top of each row above the title and description.
Enter some text and/or column substitution strings to be used as the title in each row.
Enter some text and/or column substitution strings to be used as the description in each row.

Examples.Demo Value: Nunc sit amet nunc quis magna ornare suscipit. Etiam aliquet maximus sapien, at sagittis sem gravida nec.

Help.Help Text: Enter miscellaneous content such as additional text and/or column substitution strings to display in each row.
Specify whether to display or hide the avatar for each row. When set to Yes, an avatar will be displayed with the assigned image, icon, or initials. When set to No, no avatar will be displayed.
Specify whether to display or hide the badge for each row. When set to Yes, a badge will be displayed in each row. When set to No, no badge will be displayed.
Select the type of content that will be displayed in the avatar.

Use the Media popup dialog to select a source for the avatar image.

Available options include:

  • URL
  • BLOB Column
  • URL Column
Enter a short description of the image or select a source column from the quick pick options. This will be used as alt text for the avatar image.
Select the source column to be displayed within each avatar. Only varchar2 data types are supported.
Enter an icon class or use the Pick Icon dialog to select the icon you want to add to display in the avatar.
Select the shape of the avatar. Default inherits the shape set by the containing template.
Displayed within a square with rounded corners.
Displayed within a circular shape.
Displayed within a square shape.
Displayed inline without a containing shape.
Enter a value for the badge label or select a source column from the quick pick options.
Select a source column for the badge value.
Select the source column for the state of the badge. Substitute column value with "danger", "warning", "success" or "info" for default styling.
Enter an icon class or use the Pick Icon dialog to select the icon you want to add to display in the badge.
Specify whether to display or hide the badge label. When set to Yes, the badge label will be displayed in addition to the badge value. When set to No, only the badge value will be displayed.
Select the badge style. Default inherits the style set by the containing template.
Select the shape of the badge. Default inherits the shape set by the containing template.
Displayed with rounded corners.
Displayed with circular edges.
Displayed with squared edges.
Set the size of the avatar. The default inherits the sizing set by the containing template.
Set the size of the badge. The default inherits the sizing set by the containing template.
Set the width of the content row columns. Default width is medium.

Specify whether to use the Universal Theme colors for avatar and badge row items. When set to Yes, the u-colors class will be applied to each row. When set to No, a default color will be used instead.

Template.Action Template:
{with/}
LINK_URL:=#LINK_URL#
LINK_ATTR:=#LINK_ATTR!RAW#
LABEL:=#LABEL!RAW#
ICON_CLASSES:=#ICON_CLASSES#
CSS_CLASSES:=#CSS_CLASSES#
IS_HOT:=#IS_HOT#
IS_ICON_ONLY:=#IS_ICON_ONLY#
IS_DISABLED:=#IS_DISABLED#
{apply THEME$BUTTON/}

{with/}
MENU_ID:=#MENU_ID#
LABEL:=#LABEL!RAW#
ICON_CLASSES:=#ICON_CLASSES#
CSS_CLASSES:=#CSS_CLASSES#
IS_HOT:=#IS_HOT#
IS_DISABLED:=#IS_DISABLED#
IS_ICON_ONLY:=#IS_ICON_ONLY#
{apply THEME$BUTTON/}
#MENU#

Information.Help Text: Display report content in a formatted media list. Supports avatars and badges. Available for a single row or as a report with multiple rows.

Help.Help Text: Select a source column to be used as the title.
Select a source column to be used for the row description.

Examples.Demo Value: Nunc sit amet nunc quis magna ornare suscipit. Etiam aliquet maximus sapien, at sagittis sem gravida nec.

Help.Help Text: Specify whether to display or hide the avatar for each row. When set to Yes, an avatar will be displayed with the assigned image, icon, or initials. When set to No, no avatar will be displayed.
Specify whether to display or hide the badge for each row. When set to Yes, a badge will be displayed in each row. When set to No, no badge will be displayed.
Select the type of content that will be displayed in the avatar.

Use the Media popup dialog to select a source for the avatar image.

Available options include:

  • URL
  • BLOB Column
  • URL Column
Enter a short description of the image or select a source column from the quick pick options. This will be used as alt text for the avatar image.
Select the source column to be displayed within each avatar. Only varchar2 data types are supported.
Enter an icon class or use the Pick Icon dialog to select the icon you want to add to display in the avatar.
Select the shape of the avatar. Default inherits the shape set by the containing template.
Displayed within a square with rounded corners.
Displayed within a circular shape.
Displayed within a square shape.
Displayed inline without a containing shape.
Enter a value for the badge label or select a source column from the quick pick options.
Select a source column for the badge value.
Select the source column for the state of the badge. Substitute column value with "danger", "warning", "success" or "info" for default styling.
Enter an icon class or use the Pick Icon dialog to select the icon you want to add to display in the badge.
Specify whether to display or hide the badge label. When set to Yes, the badge label will be displayed in addition to the badge value. When set to No, only the badge value will be displayed.
Select the badge style. Default inherits the style set by the containing template.
Select the shape of the badge. Default inherits the shape set by the containing template.
Displayed with rounded corners.
Displayed with circular edges.
Displayed with squared edges.
Select the number of grid columns the media list content will display in. Horizontal Span will display all columns in a single horizontal row.
Set the size of media list items.

Specify whether to use the Universal Theme colors for avatar and badge row items. When set to Yes, the u-colors class will be applied to each row. When set to No, a default color will be used instead.

Templates.Partial:
{if DISPLAY_AVATAR/} {with/} TYPE:=#AVATAR_TYPE# IMAGE:=#AVATAR_IMAGE# IMAGE_ALT:=#AVATAR_IMAGE_ALT# INITIALS:=#AVATAR_INITIALS# ICON:=#AVATAR_ICON# SHAPE:=#AVATAR_SHAPE# SIZE:= LINK:=#AVATAR_LINK# LINK_ATTR:=#AVATAR_LINK_ATTR!RAW# {apply THEME$AVATAR/} {endif/}
{if ?USER_NAME_LINK/}{endif/}#USER_NAME!RAW#{if ?USER_NAME_LINK/}{endif/} #DATE!RAW#
{if DISPLAY_BADGE/}
{with/} LABEL_DISPLAY:=#BADGE_LABEL_DISPLAY# LABEL:=#BADGE_LABEL# VALUE:=#BADGE_VALUE# ICON:=#BADGE_ICON# STATE:=#BADGE_STATE# {apply THEME$BADGE/}
{endif/}

{if ?TITLE_LINK/}{endif/}#TITLE!RAW#{if ?TITLE_LINK/}{endif/}

{if ?DESCRIPTION/}

#DESCRIPTION!RAW#

{endif/}

Information.Help Text: Display a series of events. Supports avatars and badges. Available for a single row or as a report with multiple rows.

Help.Help Text: Select a source column to be displayed as the user name associated with a timeline event.
Select a source column containing a date, date range, or time.
Select a source column to be used as the title.
Select a source column to be used for the row description.

Examples.Demo Value: Nunc sit amet nunc quis magna ornare suscipit. Etiam aliquet maximus sapien, at sagittis sem gravida nec.
